alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued March 27 at 4:10PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR BLOWING DUST FROM 400 PM MONDAY UNTIL 800 PM MONDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Blowing Dust. WHERE...Lincoln, Cheyenne, Kiowa, Bent and Prowers Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Limon, Cheyenne Wells, Eads, Las Animas and Lamar. WHEN...400 PM Monday March 27 to 800 PM Monday March 27 IMPACTS...Air Quality Health Advisory for Blowing Dust Issued for the eastern plains of Colorado Issued at 4:00 PM MDT, Monday, March 27th, 2023 Issued by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment Affected Area: Lincoln, Cheyenne, Kiowa, Prowers, and Bent Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Limon, Cheyenne Wells, Eads, Lamar, and Las Animas. Advisory in Effect: 4:00 PM MDT, Monday, March 27, 2023 to 8:00 PM MDT, Monday, March 27th, 2023. Public Health Recommendations: If significant blowing dust is present and reducing visibility to less than 10 miles across a wide area, People with heart or lung disease, older adults, and children in the affected area should reduce prolonged or heavy indoor and outdoor exertion. Outlook: Strong and gusty winds will produce areas of blowing dust on Monday. The threat for blowing dust will gradually diminish by Monday evening. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: Increasing likelihood of respiratory symptoms in sensitive individuals, aggravation of heart or lung disease and premature mortality in people with cardiopulmonary disease and older adults. People with heart or lung disease, older adults, and children should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion.
